item.title: Going Native - Ahead of time compilation in C#
item.description: Introduction With .NET 8, Microsoft is further improving support for Ahead of Time compiliation (AoT). This means that we can now compile our C# programs directly to native code. How does AoT differ from ’normal’ C# compilation? How do we actually use AoT? And what are the implications for the ecosystem? What even is compilation? When we talk about compilation, we talk about translating a program from one language to another.
